text:
Question 93) Caña El Negro Together Al Cañaveral.
El Yanqui About El Cañaveral.
La Tierra Bajo El Cañaveral.
Blood you go to us! Accessed on: 28 Feb. 2012 (fragment).
In this poem by Nicolás Guillén, in which the poet reflects on the planting of sugarcane in Latin America, the prepositions together, about and Bajo are used to indicate metaphorically
A) Disorders in the organization of sugarcane crop.
B) diplomatic relations among sugarcane producing countries.
C) Latin America locations where sugar cane is grown.
D) social relations of individuals living from the planting of sugarcane.
E) particular functions of each professional in sugarcane crop.
